intro: Pernettya angustata, commonly known as narrowleaf cowberry, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the northern regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other acid-loving plants like blueberries and heathers. The plant produces small, bright red berries that are edible and often used in jams and sauces. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand cold climates and poor soil conditions. Pernettya angustata thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in boreal and subarctic habitats.
